citation.article-title: Hoyosella altamirensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a new member of the order Actinomycetales isolated from a cave biofilm
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Hoyosella altamirensis sp. nov.
Hoyosella altamirensis [al.ta.mi.ren′sis. N.L. fem. adj. altamirensis referring to Altamira Cave (Cantabria, Spain), where the type strain was isolated].
Displays the following properties in addition to those given for the genus.
Colonies are about 1 mm in diameter.
Grows at 20–37 °C (optimum 28 °C) and in the presence of up to 6 % NaCl (optimal growth with 2–4 % NaCl).
Good growth on BHI and TSA media.
Phenotypic characteristics are reported in Table 1.
Shows high susceptibilities to some antibiotics tested, for example penicillins, aminosides and some cephalosporins; resistance is observed to trimethoprim, ceftazidime, cefamandole and clindamycin.
The type strain, OFN S31T (=CIP 109864T =DSM 45258T), was isolated from a white colony in Altamira Cave, Spain.
